item.title: Netflix, ABC Portrayals Of Autism Still Fall Short, Critics Say
item.description: August 11, 2017 - Two new TV series feature main characters who have autism. While some are applauding the fresh take on the disorder, others worry that the shows send the wrong messages.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 11, 2017 - Two new TV series feature main characters who have autism. While some are applauding the fresh take on the disorder, others worry that the shows send the wrong messages. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/11/542668400/netflix-abc-portrayals-of-autism-still-fall-short-critics-say

item.title: President Trump To Declare National Opioid Emergency
item.description: August 11, 2017 - The president said paperwork needs to be done to make it officially a national emergency. It's a change from earlier this week when Health Secretary Tom Price held off on making that declaration.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 11, 2017 - The president said paperwork needs to be done to make it officially a national emergency. It's a change from earlier this week when Health Secretary Tom Price held off on making that declaration. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/11/542767898/president-trump-to-declare-national-opioid-emergency

item.title: News Brief: Trump Speaks Out About North Korea, Opioid Crisis
item.description: August 11, 2017 - President Trump says his promise to meet Pyongyang's threats with "fire and fury" might have been too soft. And, he says he's ready to declare the nation's opioid crisis "a national emergency."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 11, 2017 - President Trump says his promise to meet Pyongyang's threats with "fire and fury" might have been too soft. And, he says he's ready to declare the nation's opioid crisis "a national emergency." http://www.npr.org/2017/08/11/542752972/morning-news-brief-trump-speaks-out-about-north-korea-opioid-crisis

item.title: Nearly 1 In 5 Hospice Patients Discharged While Still Alive
item.description:
August 11, 2017 - The hospices who discharge the most patients before their death also make the most money, a recent study shows.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/11/542607941/nearly-1-in-5-hospice-patients-discharged-while-still-alive
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 11, 2017 - The hospices who discharge the most patients before their death also make the most money, a recent study shows. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/11/542607941/nearly-1-in-5-hospice-patients-discharged-while-still-alive

item.title: Drinking On The Rise In U.S., Especially For Women, Minorities, Older Adults
item.description: August 10, 2017 - A new study in JAMA Psychiatry looks at rates of alcohol use from 2002 to 2013. Alcohol use in general went up, and problem drinking — binging, abuse and dependence — increased even more.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - A new study in JAMA Psychiatry looks at rates of alcohol use from 2002 to 2013. Alcohol use in general went up, and problem drinking — binging, abuse and dependence — increased even more. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/10/542409957/drinking-on-the-rise-in-u-s-especially-for-women-minorities-older-adults

item.title: People Back Editing Genes To Treat Disease, But Are Wary Of Inheritable Changes
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Scientists are getting closer to being able to alter people's genes permanently. A survey found that people are more cautious about changes that could be passed on to future generations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Scientists are getting closer to being able to alter people's genes permanently. A survey found that people are more cautious about changes that could be passed on to future generations. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/10/542659066/people-back-editing-genes-to-treat-disease-but-are-wary-of-inheritable-changes

item.title: A 'Vaccine For Addiction' Is No Simple Fix
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Scientists are trying to develop a vaccine to block the euphoria of heroin without interfering with other pain relief. The Trump administration hopes the approach might help with the opioid epidemic.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Scientists are trying to develop a vaccine to block the euphoria of heroin without interfering with other pain relief. The Trump administration hopes the approach might help with the opioid epidemic. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/10/542605039/a-vaccine-for-addiction-is-no-simple-fix

item.title: Trump Says He Intends To Declare Opioid Crisis National Emergency
item.description: August 10, 2017 - The comments follow a recommendation of a national commission, citing deaths of 142 people in the U.S. a day. The administration initially said it would not follow through on the recommendation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - The comments follow a recommendation of a national commission, citing deaths of 142 people in the U.S. a day. The administration initially said it would not follow through on the recommendation. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542669730/trump-says-he-intends-to-declare-opioid-crisis-national-emergency

item.title: Democrats Fear Medicare-For-All Plan Could Sharpen Party Divisions
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Sen. Bernie Sanders is promoting a Medicare-for-all health care plan, and some Democrats are worried it could sharpen divisions in the party.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Sen. Bernie Sanders is promoting a Medicare-for-all health care plan, and some Democrats are worried it could sharpen divisions in the party. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542663685/democrats-fear-medicare-for-all-plan-could-sharpen-party-divisions

item.title: Trump Declares Public Health Emergency To Address Opioid Crisis
item.description:
August 10, 2017 - President Trump said his administration is declaring the opioid crisis a national emergency. It was a surprise move.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542663671/trump-declares-public-health-emergency-to-address-opioid-crisis
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - President Trump said his administration is declaring the opioid crisis a national emergency. It was a surprise move. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542663671/trump-declares-public-health-emergency-to-address-opioid-crisis

item.title: Imagine: Facing Surgery Without An Anesthesiologist On Hand
item.description: August 10, 2017 - A new report looks at the number of anesthesiologists around the world — and finds that many countries barely have 1 per 100,000. And some have ... zero.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - A new report looks at the number of anesthesiologists around the world — and finds that many countries barely have 1 per 100,000. And some have ... zero. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/10/530885138/imagine-facing-surgery-without-an-anesthesiologist-on-hand

item.title: Widowed Early, A Cancer Doctor Writes About The Harm Of Medical Debt
item.description: August 10, 2017 - A decade after the death of her husband, Fumiko Chino is studying the strain that uncovered medical costs put on cancer patients, even those who have insurance.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - A decade after the death of her husband, Fumiko Chino is studying the strain that uncovered medical costs put on cancer patients, even those who have insurance. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/10/542589232/widowed-early-a-cancer-doctor-writes-about-the-harm-of-medical-debt

item.title: Beach Town Tries To Reverse Runaway Growth Of 'Sober Homes'
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Some local and state officials in South Florida are calling for more regulation of addiction recovery residences to help combat insurance scams.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Some local and state officials in South Florida are calling for more regulation of addiction recovery residences to help combat insurance scams. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/10/537882989/beach-town-tries-to-reverse-runaway-growth-of-sober-homes

item.title: Despite Proven Technology, Attempts To Make Table Saws Safer Drag On
item.description: August 10, 2017 - It's unclear whether the Consumer Product Safety Commission will finally pass a rule requiring all new saws to have an active injury prevention monitoring system built into them.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - It's unclear whether the Consumer Product Safety Commission will finally pass a rule requiring all new saws to have an active injury prevention monitoring system built into them. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542474093/despite-proven-technology-attempts-to-make-table-saws-safer-drag-on

item.title: 47 Hospitals Slashed Their Use Of 2 Key Heart Drugs After Huge Price Hikes
item.description: August 9, 2017 - These two older drugs, nitroprusside and isoproterenol, are frequently used in emergency and intensive care situations and have no direct alternatives, say cardiologists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - These two older drugs, nitroprusside and isoproterenol, are frequently used in emergency and intensive care situations and have no direct alternatives, say cardiologists. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/09/542485307/47-hospitals-slashed-their-use-of-two-key-heart-drugs-after-huge-price-hikes
